verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> for the sons<WH1121> of Korah.<WH7141> Lord,<WH3068> you have been favorable<WH7521> to your land:<WH776> you have brought<WH7725> back<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of Jacob.<WH3290>
You have forgiven<WH5375> the iniquity<WH5771> of your people,<WH5971> you have covered<WH3680> all<WH3605> their sin.<WH2403> Selah.<WH5542>
You have taken<WH5375> away all<WH3605> your wrath:<WH5678> you have turned<WH7725> yourself from the fierceness<WH2740> of your anger.<WH639>
Turn<WH7725> us, O God<WH430> of our salvation,<WH3468> and cause your anger<WH3708> toward<WH5973> us to cease.<WH6565>
Will you be angry<WH599> with us for ever?<WH5769> will you draw<WH4900> out your anger<WH639> to all<WH3605> generations?<WH1755>
Will you not revive<WH2421> us again:<WH7725> that your people<WH5971> may rejoice<WH8055> in you?
Show<WH7200> us your mercy,<WH2617> O LORD,<WH3068> and grant<WH5414> us your salvation.<WH3468>

I will hear<WH8085> what<WH4100> God<WH410> the LORD<WH3068> will speak:<WH1696> for he will speak<WH1696> peace<WH7965> to his people,<WH5971> and to his saints:<WH2623> but let them not turn<WH7725> again<WH7725> to folly.<WH3690>
Surely<WH389> his salvation<WH3468> is near<WH7138> them that fear<WH3373> him; that glory<WH3519> may dwell<WH7931> in our land.<WH776>
Mercy<WH2617> and truth<WH571> are met<WH6298> together; righteousness<WH6664> and peace<WH7965> have kissed<WH5401> each other.
Truth<WH571> shall spring<WH6779> out of the earth;<WH776> and righteousness<WH6664> shall look<WH8259> down from heaven.<WH8064>
Yes,<WH1571> the LORD<WH3068> shall give<WH5414> that which is good;<WH2896> and our land<WH776> shall yield<WH5414> her increase.<WH2981>
Righteousness<WH6664> shall go<WH1980> before<WH6440> him; and shall set<WH7760> us in the way<WH1870> of his steps.<WH6471>
